answers.text:
Hello Pam,
I was able to find a couple of resources to address parts of your request. I hope that you find them helpful.
The Municipal Research and Services Center released a comprehensive document regarding citizen advisory boards in 2008. It contains samples, best practices, policies, definitions, and procedures. You can find the resource here: http://www.mrsc.org/publications/lgcab08.pdf
The City of Wichita, Kansas has recently implemented District Advisory Boards, each made up of eleven citizens. You can find an overview of their program as well as a link to their bylaws here: http://www.wichita.gov/Government/CityCouncil/DAB.htm
Regards,
Pam Weir
Management Intern
Alliance for Innovation

author: Pamela Muse
text:
An Alliance member is looking for model practices of citizen/neighborhood advisory boards.  They have had neighborhood advisory boards in place since the 1980's, and are hoping to reinvent their approach. 
Please send policies, procedures, guidelines, etc that discuss your Citizen and/or Neighborhood Advisory Boards.  Specifically how they're run, out of what department, performance indicators, outcomes, etc.
Thank you, your time is appreciated
Pam
Pamela Muse
Western Regional Director
